articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters at Columbia University were occupying a building on the New York City campus on Tuesday as officials limited access to students who live there and essential employees.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters occupy building at Columbia University - CNN

articles.author: Brendan Pierson, Jack Queen
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein is due to appear in state court in Manhattan on Wednesday for the first time since New York's highest court threw out his 2020 rape conviction last week.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein expected in New York court after rape conviction overturned

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Wednesday kicked off a series of meetings with Israeli leaders discussing how to get more humanitarian aid into Gaza while at the same time repeatedly urged Palestinian militant Hamas to accept a deal offer that will release hostages and achieve a ceasefire.
articles.title: In Israel, Blinken set to push Netanyahu for sustained aid into Gaza

articles.author: Volodymyr Pavlov
articles.description: Ukrainian forces defending the strategic eastern stronghold of Chasiv Yar say they are still waiting for fresh ammunition after the United States approved a major military aid package, amid intensifying attacks from Russian troops and drones.
articles.title: Ukrainian forces near besieged Chasiv Yar say they badly need ammunition

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines on Wednesday accused China's coast guard of elevating tensions in the South China Sea after two vessels suffered damage from water cannon use by Beijing, an official said.
articles.title: Philippines says Chinese coast guard elevating tensions in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday announced the approval of more than $6.1 billion in student loan debt relief for nearly 317,000 borrowers who were enrolled at any Art Institute campus from January 2004 until October 2017.
articles.title: Biden approves $6.1 billion in student loan debt relief for Art Institute enrollees

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British authorities have detained the first migrants set to be removed to Rwanda under Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's flagship illegal migration policy, the government said on Wednesday.
articles.title: UK begins detaining migrants set to be deported to Rwanda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovakia has given temporary protection to a Ukrainian and Israeli citizen who is accused of running a pro-Russian influence campaign via a news website and is under Czech sanctions, Czech media reported.
articles.title: Slovakia gives protection to man accused of running pro-Russian influence campaign, media say

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan is on alert for China to carry out military exercises after the inauguration of President-elect Lai Ching-te this month, the island's top security official said on Wednesday, noting that Beijing usually begins such drills in June.
articles.title: Taiwan on alert for post-inauguration Chinese drills

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Ecuador accused Mexico before the International Court of Justice (ICJ) of blatant interference in Ecuadorian internal affairs on Wednesday after Mexico brought a case against Quito saying it violated international law.
articles.title: Ecuador accuses Mexico of blatant interference at World Court hearing
